title: Soraka's heals are too strong
body: For something on such a short cooldown it heals them back completely so fast and you can't even argue she takes her own health because her q returns a lot of it.

replies.body:
I see where you were getting at, I just played an Adam game last night and we left raka alone bc we felt she was useless but she ended up carrying the game (from heals and dmg), but there is counter play to her.
If you dodge her star call she loses the ability to heal back from it and with the re-introduction to executioners calling dealing with her shouldn't be much of an issue anymore

You have to actually all in the Soraka first, or have someone zone her while her frontliner or carry dies.

If you can't dive and have 1 zone her (or 2 or 3 or w/e) while you kill the target, you will probably lose but the best bet is to all in just her and if you can't do either of these, try to split push or get picks/ganks/counter-ganks.

1. To hit her q she has to either be running from being chased or position herself so risky to get a minor bit of health to heal her squishy ass.
2. Learn how to play versing her. Don't just say op. There is most probably a strategic route. Sayyyy make sure your adc is well and safe and roam while soraka is now useless because she can't kill your adc under turret. All she can do is heal.
